frame.name: Manner
frame.definition:
<def-root>A <fen>Manner</fen> describes general or specific characteristics of an event in one of three ways: First, it can refer to how a <fen>Comparison_event</fen> transpires, absent the influence of an entity (e.g. "the way you talk"). Second, it can refer to how a <fen>Salient_entity</fen> conducts, performs, or otherwise participates in a <fen>Comparison_activity</fen> (e.g. "her manner of speaking"). Thirdly, the <fen>Manner</fen> can describe a <fen>Foreground_event</fen> by relating the <fen>Foreground_event</fen> to a <fen>Manner_descriptor</fen> (e.g. "written (in) a silly way", "written the way I do"). <ex></ex> <ex><fex name="Foreground_event">He completed the task</fex> <m>in</m> a <fex name="Manner_descriptor">fervent</fex> <fex name="Manner"><t>manner</t></fex>. </ex> <ex>I love the <fex name="Manner_descriptor">smooth</fex> <fex name="Manner"><t>way</t></fex> <fex name="Comparison_event">that you talk</fex>.</ex> <ex><fex name="Foreground_event">Paul played soccer</fex> <m>in</m> a <fex name="Manner"><t>way</t></fex> <fex name="Manner_descriptor">that reminded me of my brother's playing</fex>.</ex> <ex>Much about a person can be determined from the <fex name="Manner"><t>manner</t></fex> <fex name="Comparison_event">one eats their meals</fex>.</ex> <ex> <fex name="Salient_entity">His</fex> <fex name="Manner"><t>way</t></fex> <fex name="Comparison_activity">of addressing people</fex> <m>is</m><fex name="Manner_descriptor"> quite rude</fex>.</ex>
This frame is unusual in requiring a modifying relative clause for the FE <fen>Comparison_event</fen>, and also allowing a relative clause to serve as a <fen>Manner_descriptor</fen>. The LU way.n, when definite, may be modified by a relative clause meaning "in the same manner that..."; the relative clause in such cases is annotated as <fen>Comparison_event</fen>:
<ex><fex name="Foreground_event">I did it</fex> the <t>way</t> <fex name="Comparison_event">she did</fex>.</ex>
</def-root>

FE.name: Comparison_event
FE.definition: <def-root>The <fen>Comparison_event</fen> is the principal event being characteriszed by the <fen>Manner</fen>. The <fen>Manner</fen> of this <fen>Comparison_event</fen> is often used in comparison with the <fen>Foreground_event</fen>. </def-root>

FE.name: Salient_entity
FE.definition: <def-root>The <fen>Salient_entity</fen> that is associated with or directly responsible for the <fen>Comparison_activity</fen>. </def-root>

FE.name: Foreground_event
FE.definition: <def-root>The <fen>Manner</fen> of <fen>Foreground_event</fen> is compared with the <fen>Manner</fen> of the <fen>Comparison_event</fen> (i.e. the principal event of the clause). </def-root>

FE.name: Comparison_activity
FE.definition: <def-root>The <fen>Salient_entity</fen> conducts or engages in the <fen>Comparison_activity</fen> that is being described. </def-root>

lexUnit.name: manner.n
lexUnit.definition: FN: the way in which an action is conducted by an agent.

lexUnit.name: way.n
lexUnit.definition: FN: an abstract word that describes how something gets done.
